2. Relationships and friendships are a key part of having a fulfilling life, and having a purpose helps to keep us motivated and driven.
a. Discuss the importance of supportive relationships and provide research or case studies to support this claim.
b. Explain how deriving meaning from work or other activities can contribute to happiness, and provide examples or research to illustrate this point.

VI. Happy people make conscious decisions to take care of their physical and mental wellbeing.
A. Expand on the concession: Explain the challenges some individuals face in prioritizing their physical and mental wellbeing, and discuss potential barriers to making these choices.
B. Counter Arguments
1. People who suffer from an injury or illness still have the ability to choose how much happiness they acquire.
a. Provide examples or case studies of individuals who have chosen to focus on the positive aspects of their situation, and explain how this has affected their overall wellbeing.
2. With a strong sense of motivation, we are more likely to feel a sense of accomplishment and joy when we achieve our goals, leading to increased feelings of happiness.
a. Offer specific examples of activities or practices that can help individuals achieve their goals and increase their happiness, such as exercise, journaling, or meditation
